intro: Boechera missouriensis, commonly known as Missouri rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the central United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress species. This perennial herb typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in open areas such as prairies and rocky outcrops. The plant produces small white or pale yellow flowers, and its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided. It is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in disturbed or marginal habitats.
